attributes.action: Make a marked pedestrian walkway on the A379 Dartmouth Hill, Stoke Fleming.
attributes.background: There is no safe access on this road to allow elderly people and children to walk to the village shop. Cars speed through the village, making the road extremely dangerous for pedestrians.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local roads are a matter for the local traffic authority, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
